"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b8b58863687224c3c30300#post_53b8b58863687224c3c30300
Damn; one vote for ammy, one vote for koishi.

Ammy I could go all out and make it extremely artsy; Koishi I could make it extremely elegant.
I'm kind of on the fence.
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b8b55b6368722486090300#post_53b8b55b6368722486090300
[bq="Randomosaur"]Uc9, do you think there need to be more dinosaurs in video games?[/bq]
No.  It's a niche market that only really works in park management style games and the vast majority of the time it's done elsewhere it's completely done badly cause there's no known good gameplay elements they could bring.  The only time it's really done well is for special bosses.  It's like trying to make a GOTY out of cricket.  It's not that it couldn't be done; rather it's extremely hard to do.

"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b8b85d6368722606260500#post_53b8b85d6368722606260500
I'm not saying it can't be done; rather it's too easy to fuck up.  It's not that I don't want dinosaurs in video games, and I'm not saying that I do want dinosaurs in video games; rather it's too easy to fuck up your game if you put them in.  The amount of dinosaurs in video games is already just right.
